resources.string: In this game, you can roll a die for monetary prizes. The game is really simple. On each play, we will tell you a winning number and ask you to touch the prize that goes with that number on the touch screen. This is so that we can be sure you know which prize is at stake. Then we will ask you to roll a single fair die. If you roll the winning number, you will win the prize; if you don\’t roll the winning number, you will be offered another play. In this game, the prizes are as follows: you will win 10p if you roll a \'1\' (when we asked for a \'1\'); 20p if you roll a \'2\' (when we asked for a \'2\'; and so on…so 30p if you roll a \'3\'; 40p if you roll a \'4\'; 50p if you roll a \'5\' and 60p if you roll a \'6\' The die in the game is fair and the outcomes of each play are random. You can play the game just once and you must play to the end if you want to the total value of your prizes to be added to your experiment fee.
How lucky do you feel right now?
How much control did you have over game outcomes?
How often have you spent money on gambling in the past 12 month? (This includes buying tickets for the lotteries)\"
How much of your gambling in the past 12 months was done on the Internet?
Do you find yourself unable to function without gambling?
Do you believe that losses when gambling are bound to be followed by a series of wins?
Do you find that gambling makes things seem better?
Is it ever diffcult to stop gambling?
Does gambling ever seem to make your future brighter?
Do you collect specific objects that help increase your chances of winning?
Does having a gamble help reduce tension and stress?
Does remembering how much money you won last time make you ever continue gambling?
Do you think you have some control over predicting your gambling wins?
How often have you bet more than you could really affod to lose?
How often have you needed to gamble with larger amounts of money to get the same feeling of excitement?
How often have you borrowed money or sold anything to get money to gamble?
How often have you ever felt that you had a problem with gambling?
Have you ever feltguilty about the way you gamble?
Hs your gambling caused any health problems, including stress or anxiety?
